intro: Stephania officinarum, commonly known as the Indian snakeroot, is a climbing plant native to the tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by distinctive, winged fruits. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
